attributes.action: Delay the London ULEZ congestion zone for another year due to COVID-19 crisis
attributes.additional_details: The London Mayoral and local elections were delayed for an extended year due to the COVID-19 crisis so it seems fair the government should delay the London ULEZ zone extension for another year to allow many small businesses time to get ULEZ compliant vehicles.
attributes.background: To delay the London ULEZ zone until October 2022 because many small businesses have not been able to get ULEZ compliant vehicles in time due to the COVID-19 crisis.

rejection.details:
Decisions relating to low emission zones in London are a matter for the Mayor of London and the London Assembly, not the UK Government.

You could start a petition to the London Assembly calling for a further delay to the extension of the ULEZ, if that is something you'd like to do. You can find out more about how to do this here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you find out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/
